text:
SMGL-Supported Districts in Zambia, by Facility Type and Quarter
Active Management of 
the Third Stage of Labor
Postpartum hemorrhage (PPH) is the leading 
cause of maternal mortality worldwide. More 
than one of four maternal deaths is caused 
by PPH, which is defined as blood loss of 
more than 500cc after vaginal birth and more 
than 1,000cc after C-section (World Health 
Organization, 2000). WHO recommends Active 
Management of the Third Stage of Labor 
(AMTSL) as a critical intervention to
